Job Title: Senior Supply Chain Planner

Location: Greater Boston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Supply Chain

Description:
Title: Senior Supply Chain Planner
Location: Boston, MA (On-site)

Position Overview:We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Supply Chain Planner to lead our supply chain optimization efforts. As a key member of our operations team, you will be responsible for developing and executing strategic plans to ensure efficient and cost-effective procurement, production, and distribution of materials. Your expertise will drive improvements in inventory management, demand forecasting, and supplier relations, contributing to the overall success and growth of our organization.

Key Responsibilities:Develop and implement strategic supply chain plans to optimize inventory levels, minimize lead times, and meet customer demands.Collaborate with cross-functional teams including manufacturing, procurement, logistics, and sales to forecast demand accurately and ensure timely delivery of materials.Analyze market trends, supplier performance, and industry developments to identify risks and opportunities, and proactively mitigate supply chain disruptions.Lead negotiations with suppliers to secure favorable terms, pricing, and contracts, while maintaining strong relationships and promoting ethical sourcing practices.Utilize advanced planning tools and systems to track inventory levels, monitor supplier performance, and drive continuous improvement initiatives.Provide guidance and mentorship to junior planners, fostering a culture of excellence and accountability within the supply chain team.

Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.Minimum of 5 years of experience in supply chain planning, preferably in the electronics manufacturing industry.Proven track record of developing and implementing successful supply chain strategies to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance customer satisfaction.Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis and forecasting techniques. Experience with ERP systems and advanced planning tools (e.g., SAP, Oracle, JDA) is desirable.Excellent communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across diverse teams and stakeholders.Demonstrated leadership abilities, including the capacity to coach and develop team members, and drive results in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.Certification in supply chain management (e.g., APICS CPIM, CSCP) is a plus.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
